relation: Going to movies, bowling, shopping, dinning out, etc.

UNI has a couple great little restaurants on campus in Maucker Union. The hill, which is walking distance from UNI has several great restaurants and bars. Cedar Falls in general is also filled with many excellent restaurants and bars.
I didn't ever live in dorms.
UNI has challenging yet rewarding academic expectations. The professors challenge you in your learning, but offer all of the tools and resources one needs in order to succeed.
Work hard and study! College is the most important time of your lives!

The University of Northern Iowa is a beautiful college with a great campus. Most of the class sizes are just perfect with not too many students in a class. The faculty and administration are friendly and caring.
pageTitle: University of Northern Iowa (UNI) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {352409=The University of Northern Iowa has a renowned Business Program; In 2013, the CPA exam pass percentage for students sitting was 100% on all four sections. The college offers hundreds of organizations to get involved in, and the community of the college is almost like a family. UNI is a great choice for a student looking to pursue an education in everything from business to philosophy., 71897=I love it here. Even though I don't live on campus, I am generally on campus from morning until like 10:00 PM because there are so many events/activities that go on throughout the week. It isn't too big and it isn't too small and all of my professors for my classes have done a great job teaching. I have also been able to connect with other Christians on campus through Intervarsity, Fellowship of Christian Athletes, BASIC Plus, BASIC, and Navigators. There are so many ministries and campus clubs/organizations that one can get involved in., 240390=Apply early, scholarship deadlines are early January., 393998=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Jordan from Des Moines, IA 12/30/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 1 person found it offensive. 2 of 88 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Free thinkers Hard workers Tips for prospective students Don't let having fun get the best of you your first semester. Bang for the buck Out of Iowas three state schools it is the best. It has the smallest class sizes, so you don't get lost in a mix of hundreds of other student. Am enjoying being here There are lots of different clubs and activities you can get involved in. Almost every collage has there own club and living in Residence halls helps you meet a lot of people. Am learning a lot There are tons of different classes and majors to choose from. The Liberal arts core helps
